Body: In some cases, the cognates of onomatopoetic sounds are highly similar even across unrelated languages. In these cases, the sounds of words seem to be an attempt to echo naturally occurring sounds. Other words follow etymology stemming patterns. Still others have no known relationship to what they attempt to express, or to existing expressions; I'm in fact not aware of any, but pretty sure they exist.
Title: What is the term for how close a phonetic expression is to its meaning?

OwnerUser.AboutMe: Ask a question on the new Linguistics site on Stack Exchange.
